definition: surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]

sentences.english: Yeah, like gentle breeze blowing through the cheeks, the hair dancing in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 是的，像微风吹过面颊，因为发梢在跳舞。

sentences.english: A cold breeze 19)wafted through my hair.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的微风吹过我的头发。

sentences.english: The breeze fanned our faces, please turn the fan off.
sentences.chinese: 微风轻轻吹在我们的脸上，请把电扇关掉。

sentences.english: The flag was flapping about in the light wind.
sentences.chinese: 那面旗子在微风中飘动。

sentences.english: Net curtains blow slightly in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 纱网窗帘被微风轻轻吹拂。

sentences.english: As a breeze passes over, the shadow of foliage stirs, and the painting becomes a living painting.
sentences.chinese: 微风乍起，叶影吹动，这一幅画竟变成活画了。

sentences.english: The breeze murmured in the pines.
He stood there with his hair ruffled by the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 他在那儿站着，微风吹乱了他的头发。

sentences.english: The poplar leaves rustled in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 树叶迎着微风策策作响。

sentences.english: Light as a breeze, soft as a cloud.
sentences.chinese: 轻盈如微风，柔软似白云。

sentences.english: The breeze set the flames of the street lamps quavering.
The rope dangled in the breeze.
The moon is lightening, the breeze is blowing the valley.
sentences.chinese: 皓月当空，微风轻轻吹过谷底。

sentences.english: Leaves rustled gently in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 树叶在微风中刷刷作响。

sentences.english: The feather fan was only powerful against the summer breezes.
sentences.chinese: 羽毛扇只是在夏日的微风中才有所作为。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
